RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 86. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 6 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IF WE GET LUCKY was away alertly to set the pace while clear and in the two path, then remained clear and widened the margin off the turn, then was kept to task to remain clear to prove best. BAYOU SHACK was rated along two wide, came four wide into the lane and rallied well. ASHAAB was allowed to settle early, eased out midway on the turn and came five wide into the lane and finished with good energy to just miss the place award. SPENDOLINI tracked the winner and made a mild bid three wide but faded in the drive. RAGING BEAR was bumped at the start, reserved early three wide, dropped to the inside on the turn and had no rally. LUCKY DUDE lunged at the start and was off slowly, then came four wide into the lane and was no threat. FREEDOM'S START was fractious in the gate, chased the pace four wide and weakened. KEYSTONE HANK was settled back on the inside and failed to menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Keystone Hank
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back inside, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Bayou Shack
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 2 wide, came 4 wide, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Dude
ENTRY.OWNER: Landis Pamela J and Ciardi Jr Albert A
ENTRY.COMMENT: lunged start, off slow, came 4 wide upper stretch, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Raging Bear
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, 3 wide 1/2, inside 1/4 pole, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Spendolini
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, mild bid turn, faded stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Ashaab
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, inside turn, eased out, came 5 wide,late rally

ENTRY.NAME: Freedom's Start
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate, chased pace 4 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: If We Get Lucky
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set unchallenged pace 2 wide, kept to task

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Purse 28000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since November 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since October 6 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BESTSUGARDADDYEVER was four wide into the first turn, chased the pace four wide to the seven sixteenths, then shifted in and advanced on the inside to the quarter pole, then eased out to make a three wide bid leaving the turn, then was given two pops with the crop and responded well to draw clear then was ridden out to prove much the best. EGOT A POKER FACE steadied on the inside into the first turn, then shifted out and stalked the pace four wide, then was three wide on the far turn and came four wide into the lane, then was along for the place award late. WILD VINE set a pressured pace on the inside, dug in by the furlong marker and got the nod for the show award. THUNDERIAN pressed the pace three wide and made a two wide bid on the far turn but faded the final furlong, missed show award. GOOSE HUNTER was settled two wide, swung out five wide leaving the turn and had no rally. PREDOMINATE chased the pace on the inside and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Egot a Poker Face
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied into first turn, stalked pace 4-3 wide, got 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderian
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3 wide, bid 2 wide, faded 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Predominate
ENTRY.OWNER: Landis Pamela J and Ciardi Jr Albert A
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Goose Hunter
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Wild Vine
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, dug in stretch, held 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Bestsugardaddyever
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn,shift in, inside to 1/4, bid 3 wide, ridden out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 6. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AMOUNT was void of early speed, advanced on the inside, angled out leaving the three sixteenths and made a bid and drew clear in the furlong grounds to prove best, driving. NO MORE TALK was well rated along the inside, shifted out and made a five wide bid off the turn, but proved to be no match for the winner late, clearly second best. WENTZ set a pressured pace on the inside, then made a bid to shake clear leaving the turn, but weakened the final furlong, bested rest. GUSHING OIL was four wide into the first turn, pressed the pace three wide and made a two wide bid on the turn but weakened. JUST NOD AND SMILE passed the tiring rivals. BLOOD MOON was allowed to settle early and lacked a rally. C C'S WARRIOR was five wide into the first turn, stalked the pace four wide and tired. DIGGERS DIAMOND was reserved early three wide, came wide into the lane and was not a threat. SNEADS was not a factor while wide. ARISTOCAT chased the pace three wide and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Wentz
ENTRY.OWNER: Tribe Dawg LLC and Kline Thomas
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, bid, shook clear upper stretch, faded

ENTRY.NAME: No More Talk
ENTRY.COMMENT: well rated inside, came 5 wide, bid, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Amount
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, inside advanced, angled out, bid, drew clear,

ENTRY.NAME: Diggers Diamond
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, came wide upper stretch, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Just Nod and Smile
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Blood Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Aristocat
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 3 wide, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Sneads
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, wide trip, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Gushing Oil
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, pressed 3 wide, bid 2 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: C C's Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5 wide first turn, stalked pace 4 wide, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 102. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 30800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED OR CLAIMING PRICE $32,000. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since November 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since October 6 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $32,000 (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DEE JAY was away alertly to make the front and drop to the inside on the first turn, was well handled and ridden along nearing the quarter pole and widened the margin off the turn, then drifted out slightly nearing the sixteenth marker under left handed crop, then held sway late to prove best, driving. BOSS LOGIC stalked the winner two wide, then came three wide into then was gaining in the furlong grounds and had to alter course slightly leaving the sixteenth marker and then finished willingly but could not get to the winner, second best. PRINCE OF RAIN was rated along the inside, roused leaving the five sixteenths but lacked the needed winning bid, bested rest. BUSINESS MODEL was settled early on the inside, came five wide into the lane and had no rally. GRAND WISER tracked the pace three wide and weakened. WISH FOR PEACE was reserved early, saved ground on the turn and was not a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Prince of Rain
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, roused 5/16, needed bid, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Wish for Peace
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, saved ground turn, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Business Model
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, came 5 wide upper stretch, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Grand Wiser
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Boss Logic
ENTRY.OWNER: Madison Avenue Racing Stable Inc and Jagger Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 2 wide, came 3 wide, finished willingly, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Dee Jay
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace inside, well handled,drifted slightly,held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 73. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 18000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since November 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FILTERED LIGHT was four wide into the first turn, stalked the pace and made a three wide bid on the turn to vie for command, then was two wide off the turn and dueled for the lead and then kicked clear to prove best, driving. DRY HUMOR settled out of the gate, shifted to the outside on the first turn and tracked the pace, made a four wide move on the turn to vie for command on the outside, then dueled for the lead off the turn and then could not go with the winner in the final furlong, clearly second best. FOREVER FIFI was allowed to settle on the inside, swung out five wide leaving the turn and rallied well to gain the show award. OMIKAMI was well placed throughout, three wide on the turn, came four wide into the lane and finished willingly but lost the show award late. CHARLIZE CHUB was three wide into the first turn, then set a pressured pace while in the two path, then vied for the lead in between rivals on the turn and tired. BIG SIS NIC pressed the pace and made a bid on the inside on the turn but tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Dry Humor
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, shifted out, tracked outside, bid 4 wide, vied, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Forever Fifi
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, swung out 5 wide, rallied, got 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Big Sis Nic
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside, bid inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Charlize Chub
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3 wide first turn, set pressured pace 2 wide, vied between,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Omikami
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, 3 wide turn, came 4 wide, lost 3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: Filtered Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, stalked pace 3 wide, bid 3 wide, drew clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 47. Maiden Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHUCK ADAMS vied for the lead to the outside early, made a bid to draw clear by the quarter pole and in the two path, then drew off in the drive while being shown the crop and was ridden out. FAST LEARNER vied for the lead on the inside, fell off the pace on the turn, angled out nearing the furlong marker and proved to be no match for the winner, second best. WATCH THE TRAMCAR was settled early, advanced on the inside on the turn, eased out and came three wide off the turn but flattened out, bested rest. IN THE AIR bumped at the start, tracked the pace in between rivals, came four wide off the turn and weakened. MR. NORMANDY was reserved early, five wide by the quarter pole and came wide into the lane and was not a threat. RUMORS TO BLAME stalked the early pace four wide, three wide on the turn and weakened. POLIE vied for the early lead in between rivals, steadied by the seven sixteenths and then stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Fast Learner
ENTRY.OWNER: Imaginary Stables and Simoff Andrew L
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, angled out 1/8, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Polie
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead between horses, steadied 7/16, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Watch the Tramcar
ENTRY.OWNER: Long Eric Y and Garden State Derby Club
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, advanced inside turn, came 3 wide, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: In the Air
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, tracked pace between horses, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Rumors to Blame
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 4 wide, 3 wide 1/4 pole, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Normandy
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, 5 wide 1/4 pole, came wide upper, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Chuck Adams
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied outside, bid turn, drew clear 1/4, drew off, ridden out,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHUCKA MOON was well placed early behind the front runners two wide, made a three wide bid nearing the quarter pole, split rivals leaving the turn and then had a long drive and prevailed late to prove best. NEW JERSEY HEIST pressed the early pace on the outside, made a four wide bid by the quarter pole, then had a long drive with the winner but was outfinished to just miss. BACK EAST was well rated early on the inside, eased off the inside midway on the turn and came four wide into the lane and finished well. BEJUCO was allowed to settle early, came four wide into the lane and had no rally, bested rest. Z MYSTIQUE was away alertly to set a pressured pace on the inside and weakened. GEM DANCER pressed the early pace and made a two wide bid on the turn to duel for command but came up empty in the drive. PRALINESALLSHOOKUP was reserved early, saved ground on the turn but was not a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Bejuco
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, came 4 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Back East
ENTRY.COMMENT: well rated inside, came 4 wide, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Chucka Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed 2 wide, bid 3 wide, split upper, long drive,prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Z Mystique
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pressured pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Pralinesallshookup
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, saved ground turn, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Gem Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 2 wide, bid 2 wide, empty stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: New Jersey Heist
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3 wide, bid 4 wide, outfinished
